titleStmt.title: A discourse of housebandrie No lesse profitable then delectable: declaryng how by the housebandrie, or rather housewiferie of Hennes, for fiue hundred frankes or Frenche poundes (makyng Englishe money lv.pi.xi.s̄.i.d.) once emploied, one maie gaine in the yere fower thousande and fiue hundreth frankes (whiche in Englishe money, maketh fiue hundreth poundes) of honest profite: all costes and charges deducted. Written in the Frenche tongue by Maister Prudens Choiselat. And lately translated into Englishe by R.E.
Discours oeconomique non moins utile que recreatif. English.
titleStmt.author: Prudent Le Choyselat, M.
R. E., fl. 1580.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Jhon [sic] Kyngston, for Myles Jennynges dwellyng in S. Paules Church-yard, at the signe of the Bible,

notesStmt.note: A translation of M. Prudent Le Choyselat: Discours oeconomique non moins utile que recreatif.
Another edition of STC 20452, published in 1577.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: S. Paules Church-yard, at the signe of the Bible
